p: Sporadic infections of humans with a limited number of avian virus subtypes (H5, H6, H7, H9, H10) have also been known to occur directly from avian sources, but without as yet leading to sustained human to human transmission [ 46â€“ 52]. Typically, these infections are severe in humans, often causing death, and potential zoonotic epidemics are of ongoing concern. Specific episodes with H5 and H7 viruses are considered in more detail later.
